qas.question: What group took issue with the Roman canons?
In what year was there documented criticism of Roman church law by Presbyterians?
To whom did Presbyterians complain in 1572?
For how long did the Reformed Church state that canon had been administered by members of the church?
Which church officials were responsible for the administration of canon law?
What did the Presbyterians criticize in the fifteenth century?
Who claimed the bishops have been enforcing canon law for 2000 years?

context: <b6_0>Roman canon law<b6_0/> had been criticized by <a0_0>the <b5_0>Presbyterians<b5_0/><a0_0/> as early as <a1_0>1572<a1_0/> in the Admonition to <a2_0>Parliament<a2_0/>. The protest centered on the standard defense that canon law could be retained so long as it did not contradict the civil law. According to Polly Ha, the <b7_0>Reformed Church Government<b7_0/> refuted this claiming that the <a4_0>bishops<a4_0/> had been enforcing canon law for <a3_0>1500 years<a3_0/>.
